Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2013 02:41PM scarlettm512 wrote: Thank you for the responses and good advice.  I think it helps me to remember that other people have gone through this and made it through so I can, too.  I really am very hopeful (and actually pretty confident) that it will come back benign, but I started letting myself get in panic mode and I just needed to let it out, I guess.  It feels good to just talk about it and not bottle it up. I've decided to give myself permission to be a little lazy and self-indulgent until I get my results on Friday.  I took a trip to the library and checked out some good books and I'm going to let the housework slide a little and escape into some good fiction.  I bought myself a new sports bra in a pretty aqua color just because.  I  needed a new one anyway because I'm training for a 10K -- but I decided to splurge on something pretty just so I'd have it to wear after the biopsy. I do feel much more relaxed now about the whole thing because I realize that it really is okay to feel a little scared even if the odds are greatly in my favor.  I'm only human.  I was worried that I was overreacting and reading the posts on here makes me feel more ordinary. Thank you!
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 03:00PM scarlettm512 wrote: I just got home from the biopsy.  The center was way behind schedule and I had to wait an hour, in the gown, before they did it.  Needless to say my blood pressure was a little high. The procedure itself was much better than I thought it would be.  The numbing part was painful.  Not the actual shot, but the medicine burned as it went in.  It wasn't unbearable, but it did hurt.  I didn't feel anything for the biopsy part though.  They took 3 samples and then put in the clip.  Of course, since I am afraid of needles, I kept my eyes closed the entire time.    Then they took some mammogram pics to make sure I wasn't bleeding internally, but it didn't hurt because I was still numb. But I have to say I was pleasantly surprised.  I have a lot more pain with my yearly gyno exam than this ... I'm not sure what to think about the actual biopsy.  I won't find out until Monday afternoon.  It is going to be a long weekend.  They took 3 samples and I have no idea if that is normal or not for a complex cyst.  The lady who was doing the ultrasound had done my previous ultrasound 2 days before.  She didn't recognize me by my face but told me she recognized me by my ultrasound image.  What the hell does that mean?  I hope my paranoid mind is reading more into that than I should.  She was probably just making small talk, but still. Still hopeful it is benign, but I'm sure I'll be bouncing back and forth between benign and worst case scenario all weekend long.  At least I don't have to vacuum for a couple of days :)
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2013 01:59PM scarlettm512 wrote: havel, it is hard to keep your composure around your child, but in some ways it has helped, too.  No time for weepiness and doom and gloom -- plus they do keep you busy and your mind off of everything going on. I will be so glad to get the results on Monday.  I am really starting to get overwhelmed with worry.  A couple of years ago, I had a scare with a swollen lymph node above my collarbone.  I had a mammogram then and it was fine.  And I saw a general surgeon and he said it didn't feel like anything to worry about and it would probably go away.  We both thought it was caused by an allergic reaction to the flu shot.  I waited a year, went back because it was still there and he pretty much patronized me about still worrying about my little "peanut", as he called it.  I left embarrassed and in tears.  I felt like I was a hypochondriac.  Now I'm wondering if I should have been more assertive about it.  I had a normal mammogram this year, too, but because my state passed a new law in July 2012, I was informed for the first time I have dense breast tissue and I was referred for an ultrasound which led to the biopsy.  It could be totally unrelated and the enlarged lymph node may be really have just been from the flu shot.  But it is still there and now I'm starting to worry that I should have had it biopsied 2 years ago. I know everyone goes through this worry and second guessing, but the longer I have to wait for results the more these thoughts keep creeping in.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2013 10:13PM scarlettm512 wrote: I did call.  I found out that they don't start making calls with results until after the last appointment at 5:00.  Wish I had thought to ask that before I left so I wouldn't have sat around worrying all day. I got my results and they are benign!  So relieved.  They said I had some microcalcifications (and I have no idea what that means to be honest) but that I didn't need any special follow-up -- just my yearly mammogram next year. Good luck to everyone else still playing the waiting game.  I hope your results are like mine
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 07:22AM scarlettm512 wrote: I'm going back and forth between being calm, kind of zen about the whole thing and almost a full blown panic attack.  My emotions are all over the place.  I had to make plans for my kids today because, of course, the biopsy would be on the busiest day of the week for us.  Had to arrange for my MIL to pick up my son at the bus stop and keep him until his Cub Scout meeting and my Dad to pick up my daughter after play practice and taxi her over to ice skating lessons.  My daughter started asking me questions about why I couldn't be there.  I'm a SAHM and I'm pretty much always there so she is, I think, starting to get a little worried that I keep going back to the doctor.  God forgive me, but I flat out lied to her today.  She asked me why I was going and I told her it was about my cough (I've had one since Thanksgiving and been to the doctor quite a few times about it).  I didn't plan on lying, but I wasn't planning on telling the kids much of anything except that I had an appointment I had to go to.  Usually they don't question it, so I wasn't prepared on what to say. My biopsy is at 2:30 and it seems like time is in slow motion.  Will be SO glad when the biopsy is over and I get the results. Irish, good luck with your lumpectomy today.  I can imagine that it is so very stressful to be dealing with two issues at once.  Hope you were able to get some rest and I hope that things go well for you.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2013 10:43AM scarlettm512 wrote: Well, can't get my dog in to see the Vet until Wednesday.  So far he is doing better.   I think he may have an eye infection.  Hope we can make it to Wednesday as the emergency vet is extremely expensive and we are just now paying off the bills from my son's hospital stay at Thanksgiving.  (Even with good insurance, we have a couple of thousand to cover -- so I'm trying not to panic and rush him to the emergency vet if he really doesn't need it) Still no word from the doctor.  Could not sleep at all.  It was like I was afraid to go to sleep.  I think I was afraid to have the results get here sooner, if that makes any sense.  I want to know and I don't want to know all at the same time.  I guess what I want is to know that it is not cancer and I'm afraid to hear that it is. Every single time the phone rings I literally jump out of fear.  I've even been so scared today that my heart has been racing and I've been trembling at times.  If I had any idea how anxiety ridden I would be during this, I would have asked the doctor for some kind of anti-anxiety medicine.  I'm a mess.  I'm a room parent for my daughter's class and, of course, today would be the day that the other room parent has to call me several times to coordinate an event coming up.  I'm sure she thinks I am a total flake because I can't seem to concentrate or make a decision on any of the stuff.  I almost told her about it, but then didn't because I'm afraid her daughter will get wind of it accidentally and then my daughter will freak out if she hears something like that.  Hopefully next week we can have a laugh about what a spaz I was on the phone. I'll be so glad when this day is over.  And if I don't get the results, I think my head might actually explode.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2013 10:16PM scarlettm512 wrote: Oh, and thank you to everyone for all the replies and encouragement.  I really don't know if I could have made it through this whole process without the support here.  Thank you so much!
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2013 03:48AM scarlettm512 wrote: Danawp, thanks for the advice.  I really do try to cling to that "don't go there until you are there", because logically I know the odds are very much in my favor.  Still it is just hard to do sometimes.  And I'm a worrier by nature, so it is doubly hard. Lorie101, good luck with your situation.  I'll be hoping for good results for you, too.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2013 07:26AM - edited Mar 17, 2013 07:27AM by scarlettm512 april, I live in VA.  When the first called me back because I had dense breast tissue and they thought I should have an ultrasound, I freaked out.  Then I read about the new law and I realized that this was the reason for my first callback ever so I calmed down and thought it was basically just a precaution.  Now I'm back to freaking out since the biopsy havel, I know the woulda, coulda, shoulda game is pretty useless -- but I've been playing it quite a bit this weekend.  However, since mine happened 2 years ago, even if it was something back then and all I have now is a complex cyst (and that one enlarged lymph node), then surely if it is cancer -- it is at least a slow growing one so I know I shouldn't even waste energy worrying about it.  Of course, knowing how you should react and actually being able to react that way are 2 different things I'm starting to think that worrying actually does slow down time.  It has to.  This has been the longest weekend ever ... I think I missed my calling as a theoretical physicist
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2013 11:02AM scarlettm512 wrote: I feel like I am having a nervous breakdown.  Today is the first day I've actually been crying.  But not about me and this biopsy thing.  My dog has developed a problem with his eyes.  He has some drainage and his eyes appear to be rolling back in his head a little.  But he doesn't appear to be in pain and he can walk and eat and responds to us.  He doesn't appear to even be having any vision problems, but he has been keeping his eyes closed more than usual.  So, now on top of worrying about myself and my mom in the hospital with pneumonia -- now I have to worry that my dog is sick.  Right now, I'm trying to wait until we can go to our regular vet tomorrow, but I'll take him to the emergency vet tonight if I have to.  Our other dog is battling an infected paw, but that hasn't been as worrisome as this is. I really feel like I just cannot take one more bad thing right now.  I feel like I've managed to handle everything pretty well considering ... but this is like the straw that broke the camel's back.  I'm just a mess.  Now waiting until tomorrow is going to be even worse.  And if I get bad news about myself and my dog tomorrow -- I just don't know what I'll do.  My dogs are my furry babies.  Of course, I love my kids more -- but they are a very, very close second.  I'm definitely having a pity party for myself right now.  If it weren't for the fact that I've developed an allergy to alcohol (part of the lymph node saga a couple of years ago -- I got an allergy to alcohol and sunscreen as part of the deal), I swear I'd be opening a big bottle of wine right about now ... Thanks for letting me whine and cry and be a baby.  I'm just emotionally exhausted at this point.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2013 08:59PM scarlettm512 wrote: havel, congrats on the benign letter -- but I would be like you, a little confused as to why you have to come in in 4 months for more study if it is benign.  Maybe this is standard after a biopsy to make sure there haven't been any changes?  A biopsy only takes a small sample, so maybe they are just going to get images to make sure that the biopsy didn't miss anything? But, at least it said benign.  That is better than the alternative schatziebest, I know exactly what you mean about the worry and the fact that other people tell you it will all be okay doesn't really help at all.  Even though they are very well meaning, it just doesn't help.  I've found the reassurances here to be much more calming because the women here have been through exactly what we are going through and they get it.  It helps tremendously to know I can come here and vent and be scared or mad or whatever without having to care if my feelings are causing anyone else to worry, too.  Praying everything goes well for you, too.  Praying it goes well for everyone here.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2013 01:07PM scarlettm512 wrote: I think the office closes at 5:00 and I still haven't heard anything.  The sheet says that if I haven't heard within 2 business days to call.  Well, today is that 2nd business day and I don't know whether I should call or not.  I'd hate to have to wait one more night.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 11:46AM scarlettm512 wrote: I'm getting a core needle biopsy tomorrow, too, and have been very anxious about it.  I've been trying to analyze every little thing:  from what they said to the expression on their faces during the last ultrasound.  I've come to the conclusion that I'd probably have better luck reading tea leaves and should just try to stay busy and keep my mind off of it as much as possible.  Wish I had some advice to give, but I just wanted to say I'm going through the same thing and I wish you much luck for a benign outcome!  Here's hoping both our doctors are just being very cautious instead of taking a wait and see approach like some others do!
Posts.Title: going for a core biopsy tomorrow for 2 spots in left breast! lisalis lisalis

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2013 10:10AM scarlettm512 wrote: Well, I am no expert by any means, but one thing you could consider is cystic acne or a boil (which cystic acne basically is).  It can be very painful, warm to the touch.  It will be red at first, grow bigger and eventually when it "ripens", it can have a yellowish or whitish center.  If it is very close the surface, sometimes it will spontaneously drain.  If not, it may have to be drained (by a doctor lancing it).  I have been treated several times for cystic acne and it can occur anywhere on the body. But, as others said, no one here can really tell you what it is.  Any time you are concerned, you really just need to go to the doctor.  Don't worry whether it is "serious enough" to go.  If it causes you worry, that is serious enough.  Good luck.  Hope you find an answer soon.
Posts.Title: Red spot w/white spot on breast... Aleahh april485

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2013 02:56PM scarlettm512 wrote: Well, the only way to really know what it is is to get it checked out by the doctor.  My doctor thought my breasts felt a little "lumpy, bumpy" as he said at my gyno appointment, but nothing to worry about.  Had my routine yearly mammogram the same day which led to an ultrasound.  The breast he was saying that about had a fluid filled cyst.  Nothing to worry about and doesn't even need to be followed.  The other breast that he didn't remark on had a complex cyst and I just had a biopsy for that one.  But chances are good that it is not cancer.  My cousin had a small lump and had it biopsied and it turned out just to be a fibroadenoma (sp?). If you are worried, don't be afraid to call and get it checked out.  Chances are good that it is nothing serious.
